inputUser.comment: Defines a user for further interaction.

inputPeerChat.comment: Defines a chat for further interaction.

inputPeerUser.comment: Defines a user for further interaction.

inputUserEmpty.comment: Empty constructor, does not define a user.

arguments.peer: The chat where the user was seen
arguments.user_id: The identifier of the user that was seen

arguments.client_id: An arbitrary 64-bit integer: it should be set, for example, to an incremental number when using {@link contacts.RawImportContactsRequest}, in order to retry importing only the contacts that weren't imported successfully, according to the client_ids returned in {@link contacts.RawImportedContacts}.retry_contacts.

inputFileBig.comment: Assigns a big file (over 10 MB in size), saved in part using the method {@link upload.RawSaveBigFilePartRequest}.

arguments.id: Random file id, created by the client
arguments.name: Full file name

inputMediaEmpty.comment: Empty media content of a message.

inputFile.comment: Defines a file saved in parts using the method {@link upload.RawSaveFilePartRequest}.

arguments.id: Random file identifier created by the client
arguments.name: Full name of the file
arguments.md5_checksum: In case the file's md5-hash was passed, contents of the file will be checked prior to use

arguments.spoiler: Whether this media should be hidden behind a spoiler warning
arguments.ttl_seconds: Time to live in seconds of self-destructing photo

arguments.nosound_video: Whether the specified document is a video file with no audio tracks (a GIF animation (even as MPEG4), for example)

arguments.thumb: Thumbnail of the document, uploaded as for the file
arguments.attributes: Attributes that specify the type of the document (video, audio, voice, sticker, etc.)
arguments.ttl_seconds: Time to live in seconds of self-destructing document

arguments.venue_type: Venue type in the provider's database

arguments.spoiler: Whether this media should be hidden behind a spoiler warning

inputMediaDocumentExternal.comment: Document that will be downloaded by the telegram servers

arguments.spoiler: Whether this media should be hidden behind a spoiler warning
arguments.ttl_seconds: Self-destruct time to live of document

arguments.title: Product name, 1-32 characters
arguments.photo: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service. People like it better when they see what they are paying for.
arguments.payload: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use for your internal processes.
arguments.provider_data: JSON-encoded data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.
arguments.start_param: Unique bot deep links start parameter. If present, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a URL button with a deep link to the bot (instead of a Pay button), with the value used as the start parameter. If absent, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a Pay button, allowing multiple users to pay directly from the forwarded message, using the same invoice.

arguments.stopped: Whether sending of the geolocation was stopped
arguments.heading: For live locations, a direction in which the location moves, in degrees; 1-360.
arguments.period: Validity period of the current location
arguments.proximity_notification_radius: For live locations, a maximum distance to another chat member for proximity alerts, in meters (0-100000)

arguments.emoticon: The emoji, for now , and are supported

arguments.peer: Peer where the story was posted

inputChatPhoto.comment: Existing photo to be set as a chat profile photo.

inputChatUploadedPhoto.comment: New photo to be set as group profile photo. The file, video and video_emoji_markup flags are mutually exclusive.

arguments.file: File saved in parts using the method {@link upload.RawSaveFilePartRequest}
arguments.video: Square video for animated profile picture
arguments.video_start_ts: Floating point UNIX timestamp in seconds, indicating the frame of the video/sticker that should be used as static preview; can only be used if video or video_emoji_markup is set.
arguments.video_emoji_markup: Animated sticker profile picture, must contain either a {@link RawVideoSizeEmojiMarkup} or a {@link RawVideoSizeStickerMarkup} constructor.

inputGeoPoint.comment: Defines a GeoPoint by its coordinates.

arguments.accuracy_radius: The estimated horizontal accuracy of the location, in meters; as defined by the sender.

inputEncryptedFileLocation.comment: Location of encrypted secret chat file.

arguments.id: File ID, id parameter value from {@link RawEncryptedFile}

arguments.secret: Check sum to access the file

inputPhoto.comment: Defines a photo for further interaction.

inputDocumentFileLocation.comment: Document location (video, voice, audio, basically every type except photo)

arguments.thumb_size: Thumbnail size to download the thumbnail

arguments.id: File ID, id parameter value from {@link RawSecureFile}

inputPhotoFileLocation.comment: Use this object to download a photo with {@link upload.RawGetFileRequest} method

arguments.id: Photo ID, obtained from the {@link RawPhoto} object
arguments.access_hash: Photo's access hash, obtained from the {@link RawPhoto} object
arguments.thumb_size: The PhotoSize to download: must be set to the type field of the desired PhotoSize object of the {@link RawPhoto}

arguments.scale: Specifies the duration of the video segment to fetch in milliseconds, by bitshifting 1000 to the right scale times: duration_ms := 1000 >> scale
arguments.video_quality: Selected video quality (0 = lowest, 1 = medium, 2 = best)

user.comment: Indicates info about a certain user

arguments.restricted: Access to this user must be restricted for the reason specified in restriction_reason

arguments.scam: This may be a scam user

arguments.fake: If set, this user was reported by many users as a fake or scam user: be careful when interacting with them.

arguments.premium: Whether this user is a Telegram Premium user

arguments.bot_can_edit: Whether we can edit the profile picture, name, about text and description of this bot because we own it.
arguments.stories_hidden: Whether we have hidden Â» all active stories of this user.
arguments.bot_info_version: Version of the {@link RawUserFull}, incremented every time it changes
arguments.restriction_reason: Contains the reason why access to this user must be restricted.
arguments.bot_inline_placeholder: Inline placeholder for this inline bot

userStatusEmpty.comment: User status has not been set yet.

arguments.dc_id: DC ID where the photo is stored

arguments.expires: Time to expiration of the current online status

For example, when a user writes to us for the first time and we have set a default messages TTL of 1 week, this service message (with auto_setting_from=our_userid) will be emitted before our first message.

arguments.notify_cloud_delay_ms: If we are offline, but online from some other client then delay sending the offline notification for notify_cloud_delay_ms milliseconds.

arguments.call_ring_timeout_ms: Maximum allowed incoming ring time in VoIP calls: if the current user doesn't reply within the specified time (in milliseconds), the call will be automatically refused
arguments.call_connect_timeout_ms: VoIP connection timeout: if the instance of libtgvoip on the other side of the call doesn't connect to our instance of libtgvoip within the specified time (in milliseconds), the call must be aborted
arguments.call_packet_timeout_ms: If during a VoIP call a packet isn't received for the specified period of time, the call must be aborted

updateServiceNotification.comment: A service message for the user. The app must show the message to the user upon receiving this update. In case the popup parameter was passed, the text message must be displayed in a popup alert immediately upon receipt. It is recommended to handle the text as you would an ordinary message in terms of highlighting links, etc. The message must also be stored locally as part of the message history with the user id 777000 (Telegram Notifications).

arguments.popup: If set, the message must be displayed in a popup.
arguments.inbox_date:
When was the notification received
The message must also be stored locally as part of the message history with the user id 777000 (Telegram Notifications).

or A = g ^ a mod p otherwise

keyboardButtonUrlAuth.comment: Button to request a user to authorize via URL using Seamless Telegram Login. When the user clicks on such a button, {@link messages.RawRequestUrlAuthRequest} should be called, providing the button_id and the ID of the container message. The returned {@link RawUrlAuthResultRequest} object will contain more details about the authorization request (request_write_access if the bot would like to send messages to the user along with the username of the bot which will be used for user authorization). Finally, the user can choose to call {@link messages.RawAcceptUrlAuthRequest} to get a {@link RawUrlAuthResultAccepted} with the URL to open instead of the url of this constructor, or a {@link RawUrlAuthResultDefault}, in which case the url of this constructor must be opened, instead. If the user refuses the authorization request but still wants to open the link, the url of this constructor must be used.

arguments.fwd_text: New text of the button in forwarded messages.
arguments.url:
An HTTP URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in Receiving authorization data.

NOTE: Services must always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in Checking authorization.
arguments.button_id: ID of the button to pass to {@link messages.RawRequestUrlAuthRequest}

inputKeyboardButtonUrlAuth.comment: Button to request a user to {@link messages.RawAcceptUrlAuthRequest} via URL using Seamless Telegram Login.

arguments.request_write_access: Set this flag to request the permission for your bot to send messages to the user.
arguments.fwd_text: New text of the button in forwarded messages.
arguments.url:
An HTTP URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in Receiving authorization data.
NOTE: You must always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in Checking authorization.
arguments.bot: Username of a bot, which will be used for user authorization. See Setting up a bot for more details. If not specified, the current bot's username will be assumed. The url's domain must be the same as the domain linked with the bot. See Linking your domain to the bot for more details.

arguments.selective:
Use this flag if you want to remove the keyboard for specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

Example: A user votes in a poll, bot returns confirmation message in reply to the vote and removes the keyboard for that user, while still showing the keyboard with poll options to users who haven't voted yet

replyKeyboardForceReply.comment: Force the user to send a reply

arguments.single_use: Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat â€“ the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again.
arguments.selective:
Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.
Example: A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.
arguments.placeholder: The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the keyboard is active; 1-64 characters.

arguments.resize: Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). If not set, the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.
arguments.single_use: Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat â€“ the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again.
arguments.selective:
Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

Example: A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.
arguments.persistent: Requests clients to always show the keyboard when the regular keyboard is hidden.
arguments.placeholder: The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the keyboard is active; 1-64 characters.

auth.codeTypeSms.comment: The next time, the authentication code will be delivered via an immediately canceled incoming call.

auth.sentCodeTypeFlashCall.comment: The code will be sent via a flash phone call, that will be closed immediately. The phone code will then be the phone number itself, just make sure that the phone number matches the specified pattern.

auth.sentCodeTypeMissedCall.comment: The code will be sent via a flash phone call, that will be closed immediately. The last digits of the phone number that calls are the code that must be entered manually by the user.

arguments.length: Length of the verification code

auth.sentCodeTypeSetUpEmailRequired.comment: The user should add and verify an email address in order to login as described here Â».

maskCoords.comment: Position on a photo where a mask should be placed when attaching stickers to media Â» The n position indicates where the mask should be placed:

arguments.y: Shift by Y-axis measured in widths of the mask scaled to the face size, from left to right. (For example, -1.0 will place the mask just below the default mask position)
arguments.zoom: Mask scaling coefficient. (For example, 2.0 means a doubled size)

labeledPrice.comment: This object represents a portion of the price for goods or services.

arguments.label: Portion label
arguments.amount: Price of the product in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

arguments.name_requested: Set this flag if you require the user's full name to complete the order
arguments.phone_requested: Set this flag if you require the user's phone number to complete the order
arguments.email_requested: Set this flag if you require the user's email address to complete the order
arguments.shipping_address_requested: Set this flag if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order
arguments.flexible: Set this flag if the final price depends on the shipping method
arguments.phone_to_provider: Set this flag if user's phone number should be sent to provider
arguments.email_to_provider: Set this flag if user's email address should be sent to provider
arguments.recurring: Whether this is a recurring payment
arguments.prices: Price breakdown, a list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.)
arguments.max_tip_amount: The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).
arguments.suggested_tip_amounts: A vector of suggested amounts of tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.

chatAdminRights.comment: Represents the rights of an admin in a channel/supergroup.

arguments.change_info: If set, allows the admin to modify the description of the channel/supergroup
arguments.post_messages: If set, allows the admin to post messages in the channel
arguments.edit_messages: If set, allows the admin to also edit messages from other admins in the channel
arguments.delete_messages: If set, allows the admin to also delete messages from other admins in the channel
arguments.ban_users: If set, allows the admin to ban users from the channel/supergroup
arguments.invite_users: If set, allows the admin to invite users in the channel/supergroup
arguments.pin_messages: If set, allows the admin to pin messages in the channel/supergroup
arguments.add_admins: If set, allows the admin to add other admins with the same (or more limited) permissions in the channel/supergroup
arguments.manage_call: If set, allows the admin to change group call/livestream settings
arguments.other: Set this flag if none of the other flags are set, but you still want the user to be an admin: if this or any of the other flags are set, the admin can get the chat admin log, get chat statistics, get message statistics in channels, get channel members, see anonymous administrators in supergroups and ignore slow mode.
arguments.manage_topics: If set, allows the admin to create, delete or modify forum topics Â».
arguments.post_stories: If set, allows the admin to post stories as the channel.
arguments.edit_stories: If set, allows the admin to edit stories posted by the other admins of the channel.
arguments.delete_stories: If set, allows the admin to delete stories posted by the other admins of the channel.

chatBannedRights.comment: Represents the rights of a normal user in a supergroup/channel/chat. In this case, the flags are inverted: if set, a flag does not allow a user to do X.

arguments.view_messages: If set, does not allow a user to view messages in a supergroup/channel/chat
arguments.send_messages: If set, does not allow a user to send messages in a supergroup/chat
arguments.send_media: If set, does not allow a user to send any media in a supergroup/chat
arguments.send_stickers: If set, does not allow a user to send stickers in a supergroup/chat
arguments.send_gifs: If set, does not allow a user to send gifs in a supergroup/chat
arguments.send_games: If set, does not allow a user to send games in a supergroup/chat
arguments.send_inline: If set, does not allow a user to use inline bots in a supergroup/chat.
arguments.embed_links: If set, does not allow a user to embed links in the messages of a supergroup/chat
arguments.send_polls: If set, does not allow a user to send polls in a supergroup/chat
arguments.change_info: If set, does not allow any user to change the description of a supergroup/chat
arguments.invite_users: If set, does not allow any user to invite users in a supergroup/chat
arguments.pin_messages: If set, does not allow any user to pin messages in a supergroup/chat
arguments.manage_topics: If set, does not allow any user to create, delete or modify forum topics Â».
arguments.send_photos: If set, does not allow a user to send photos in a supergroup/chat.
arguments.send_videos: If set, does not allow a user to send videos in a supergroup/chat.
arguments.send_roundvideos: If set, does not allow a user to send round videos in a supergroup/chat.
arguments.send_audios: If set, does not allow a user to send audio files in a supergroup/chat.
arguments.send_voices: If set, does not allow a user to send voice messages in a supergroup/chat.
arguments.send_docs: If set, does not allow a user to send documents in a supergroup/chat.
arguments.send_plain: If set, does not allow a user to send text messages in a supergroup/chat.
arguments.until_date: Validity of said permissions (it is considered forever any value less then 30 seconds or more then 366 days).

inputWallPaperSlug.comment: Wallpaper by slug (a unique ID, obtained from a wallpaper link Â»)

inputWallPaperNoFile.comment: Wallpaper with no file access hash, used for example when deleting (unsave=true) wallpapers using {@link account.RawSaveWallPaperRequest}, specifying just the wallpaper ID.

codeSettings.comment: Settings used by telegram servers for sending the confirm code. Example implementations: telegram for android, tdlib.

arguments.motion: If set, the background needs to be slightly moved when the device is rotated.
arguments.background_color: Used for solid Â», gradient Â» and freeform gradient Â» fills.
arguments.second_background_color: Used for gradient Â» and freeform gradient Â» fills.
arguments.rotation: Clockwise rotation angle of the gradient, in degrees; 0-359. Should be always divisible by 45.

restrictionReason.comment: Restriction reason. Contains the reason why access to a certain object must be restricted. Clients are supposed to deny access to the channel if the platform field is equal to all or to the current platform (ios, android, wp, etc.). Platforms can be concatenated (ios-android, ios-wp), unknown platforms are to be ignored. The text is the error message that should be shown to the user.

The fill to be used as a background for outgoing messages, in RGB24 format.

Whether this constructor is a reduced version of the full topic information.
If set, only the my, closed, id, date, title, icon_color, icon_emoji_id and from_id parameters will contain valid information.
Reduced info is usually only returned in topic-related admin log events Â» and in the {@link messages.RawChannelMessages} constructor: if needed, full information can be fetched using {@link channels.RawGetForumTopicsByIDRequest}.

This is useful, for example, if we need to display a progress/total counter (like photo 134 of 200, for all media in a chat, we could simply use photo ${offset_id_offset} of ${count}.

Used to split the messages by days: multiple SearchResultsCalendarPeriod constructors are returned, each containing information about the first, last and total number of messages matching the filter that were sent on a specific day.
This information can be easily used to split the returned messages by day.

contacts.getLocated.comment: Get users and geochats near you, see here Â» for more info.

arguments.background:
While the geolocation of the current user is public, clients should update it in the background every half-an-hour or so, while setting this flag.
Do this only if the new location is more than 1 KM away from the previous one, or if the previous location is unknown.
arguments.self_expires: If set, the geolocation of the current user will be public for the specified number of seconds; pass 0x7fffffff to disable expiry, 0 to make the current geolocation private; if the flag isn't set, no changes will be applied.

throws.comment: Invalid geoposition provided.

throws.comment: You must have a profile picture to publish your geolocation.

messages.setInlineBotResults.comment: Answer an inline query, for bots only

arguments.gallery: Set this flag if the results are composed of media files
arguments.private: Set this flag if results may be cached on the server side only for the user that sent the query. By default, results may be returned to any user who sends the same query
arguments.query_id: Unique identifier for the answered query
arguments.results: Vector of results for the inline query
arguments.cache_time: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the result of the inline query may be cached on the server. Defaults to 300.
arguments.next_offset: Pass the offset that a client should send in the next query with the same text to receive more results. Pass an empty string if there are no more results or if you don't support pagination. Offset length can't exceed 64 bytes.
arguments.switch_pm: If passed, clients will display a button on top of the remaining inline result list with the specified text, that switches the user to a private chat with the bot and sends the bot a start message with a certain parameter.
arguments.switch_webview: If passed, clients will display a button on top of the remaining inline result list with the specified text, that switches the user to the specified bot web app.

arguments.query_id: Unique identifier for the query to be answered
arguments.error: Error message in human readable form that explains why it is impossible to complete the order (e.g. "Sorry, delivery to your desired address is unavailable"). Telegram will display this message to the user.
arguments.shipping_options: A vector of available shipping options.

messages.setBotPrecheckoutResults.comment:
Once the user has confirmed their payment and shipping details, the bot receives an {@link RawUpdateBotPrecheckoutQuery} update.
Use this method to respond to such pre-checkout queries.
Note: Telegram must receive an answer within 10 seconds after the pre-checkout query was sent.

arguments.success: Set this flag if everything is alright (goods are available, etc.) and the bot is ready to proceed with the order, otherwise do not set it, and set the error field, instead
arguments.query_id: Unique identifier for the query to be answered
arguments.error: Required if the success isn't set. Error message in human readable form that explains the reason for failure to proceed with the checkout (e.g. "Sorry, somebody just bought the last of our amazing black T-shirts while you were busy filling out your payment details. Please choose a different color or garment!"). Telegram will display this message to the user.

throws.name: ERROR_TEXT_EMPTY
throws.comment: The provided error message is empty.
